intro: Glochidion taitense var. pitcairnense, commonly known as Pitcairn glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Pitcairn Islands and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces clusters of greenish-yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
